title: EdgenCode
description: Visual Studio Code extension providing AI-powered chat and code assistance.
subtitle: VS Code Extension with AI Chat Capabilities
overview: A Visual Studio Code extension similar to EdgenChat, providing AI-powered chat and code assistance directly within the IDE. Built using VS Code extension APIs and integrating with the local model inference system.

coreConcept.summary: VS Code extension bringing AI chat to the development environment.

features: VS Code integration: native extension running within the IDE
Chat interface: AI-powered chat accessible from the editor
Code assistance: get help with code-related questions
API integration: connects to local model inference system
Developer workflow: designed to fit into existing development processes
Extension architecture: built using VS Code extension APIs

projectStructure: VS Code extension manifest and configuration
deployment: Distribution via VS Code marketplace or private repository

personalExperience:
I also worked on an application similar to the previous one (EdgenChat), but this one needed to run as a Visual Studio extension, which I had no experience in doing. After digging through the VS documentation and some open source projects on GitHub, I was able to somewhat understand how to code a working VS extension and produce a working app that fit our purpose.

This project was particularly challenging because I had to learn the VS Code extension architecture from scratch. Understanding how extensions work, how to create webviews, and how to integrate with the VS Code API was a steep learning curve. However, it was very rewarding to see the extension working within the IDE and providing value to developers.
